title: Critical Thinking Enhancement Program in Health Education Through Virtual Environment Co-Design

context.prior_knowledge: Practical Experience in Physical Therapy or Related Health Fields, and Basic Digital Tool Proficiency
context.additional_context: Process for practicing physical therapists to co-design real clinical cases in a 360-degree virtual environment while practicing critical thinking; provides immersive learning through mXR (Mobile Extended Reality) technology

learning_goals: Learners can analyze health-related case scenarios in virtual environments and develop appropriate exercise prescription plans
Learners can evaluate and improve the clinical validity of case studies designed in a virtual environment through peer feedback.

Learners achieve a 15% or greater improvement in six areas—analysis, interpretation, reasoning, deductive thinking, and quantitative skills—based on the Health Science Reasoning Test (HSRT-N) criteria.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
